item.name: Belt of three throwing weapons
item: Belt of three superior throwing weapons

item.name: Belt of three throwing weapons
rule: When you hit somebody call Stumble.
You can reuse throwing weapons.
item.physrep: Up to three LARP safe throwing Weapons.

item.name: Belt of three superior throwing weapons
rule: When you hit somebody call Stumble.
You can reuse throwing weapons.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a throw skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.
item.physrep: Up to three LARP safe throwing Weapons.

item.name: Crude Light weapon
rule: This item is large.
Skills cost 1 WP extra to perform with this weapon.
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 30 cm to 60 cm.

item.name: Light weapon
rule: This item is large.
Skills cost 1 WP extra to perform with this weapon.
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 30 cm to 60 cm.

item.name: Superior Light weapon
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 30 cm to 60 cm.

item.name: Crude Medium weapon
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 60 cm to 110 cm.

item.name: Medium weapon
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 60 cm to 110 cm.

item.name: Superior Medium weapon
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a strike skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.
item.physrep: Weapons with a length of 60 cm to 110 cm.

item.name: Great weapon
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a strike skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.
Once per day call stumble on a person to close to hit with this weapon.
item.physrep: Two-handed weapons with a length of 110 cm to 150 cm.

item.name: Superior Great weapon
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a strike skill twice without paying its willpower cost this day.
Twice per day call stumble on a person to close to hit with this weapon.
item.physrep: Two-handed weapons with a length of 110 cm to 150 cm.

item.name: Pole Weapon
item.physrep: Staff-like weapons with a length of 150 cm to 215 cm.

item.name: Superior Pole Weapon
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a strike skill twice without paying its willpower cost this day.
Once per day call stumble on a person to close to hit with this weapon.
item.physrep: Staff-like weapons with a length of 150 cm to 215 cm.

item.name: Stabbing weapon
item.physrep: Two-handed weapons with a length of 110 cm to 150 cm. LARP-safe to stab with.

item.name: Superior Stabbing weapon
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a strike skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.
item.physrep: Two-handed weapons with a length of 110 cm to 150 cm. LARP-safe to stab with.

item.name: Superior Bow
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a shot skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.

item.name: Superior Crossbow
rule: This item is large.
If you had this weapon at the beginning of the day you can perform a shot skill once without paying its willpower cost this day.

skill.name: Focused Strike Level 1
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 2
skill.details: This skill heightens the chance that your blow will injure the enemy.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 4 points

skill.name: Focused Strike Level 2
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 3
skill.details: You might even be able to disable an armoured enemy with a single blow.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 3 by training 4 points

skill.name: Focused Strike Level 3
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 4
skill.details: Precision and superior force enable you to drop most armoured combatants with ease.

skill.name: Breaking Strike level 1
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you intentionally strike an opponent's weapon or shield and spend 2 WP you can call Break 1 but your weapon also receives this effect.
skill.details: Breaking shields or bending enemy weapons is a handy skill. It reduces the value of your loot, but at least you survive the combat. It is extremely potent against most shields or bad quality weapons.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 6 points

skill.name: Breaking Strike level 2
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you intentionally strike an opponent's weapon or shield and spend 2 WP you can call Break 1 or Break 2 but your weapon also receives this effect.
skill.details: You will be able to break the toughest of shields and most weapons.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 3 by training 6 points

skill.name: Breaking Strike level 3
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you intentionally strike an opponent's weapon or shield and spend 1 WP you can call Break 1 or Break 2 but your weapon also receives this effect.
skill.details: Breaking stuff doesn't tire you as much as it used to do.

skill.name: Shoving Strike Level 1
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill.
If you grab the tip of your weapon with your off-hand, move the weapon towards your opponent and spend 1WP you can call Stumble.
skill.details: Especially useful against multiple enemies or enemies with shorter weapons than you.

skill.name: Tackling strike Level 1
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent on a leg and spend 2WP you can call Hit 1 Fall.
skill.details: Hitting knees or sweeping feet away might cause your enemy to drop to the ground.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 4 points

skill.name: Tackling strike Level 2
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent on a leg and spend 1WP you can call Hit 1 Fall.
skill.details: You have gotten much more proficient hitting low.

skill.name: Disarming strike Level 1
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent on the arm where they hold a weapon twice and spend 2WP you can call Hit 1 Drop Weapon.
skill.details: After hammering your opponent's weapon arm, a clumsy and tired fighter will surely drop it.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 4 points

skill.name: Disarming strike Level 2
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent on the arm where they hold a weapon and spend 2WP you can call Hit 1 Drop Weapon.
skill.details: You have gotten much more proficient at disarming somebody.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 5 points

skill.name: Disarming strike Level 3
rule: Use a large melee weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent on the arm where they hold a weapon and spend 1WP you can call Hit 1 Drop Weapon.
skill.details: Disarming somebody doesn't tire you as much as it used to do.

skill.name: Damaging Throw
rule: Use a throwing weapon for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 1 WP you can call Hit 1
skill.details: To actually hurt somebody with throwing knifes or other thrown weapons requires practice.

skill.name: Focused Shot Level 1
rule: Use a bow or crossbow for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 2
skill.details: This skill heightens the chance that your arrow will injure the enemy.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 2 by training 4 points

skill.name: Focused Shot Level 2
rule: Use a bow or crossbow for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 3
skill.details: You might even be able to disable an armoured enemy with a single shot.
skill.level: Upgrade to Level 3 by training 4 points

skill.name: Focused Shot Level 3
rule: Use a bow or crossbow for this skill
If you hit an opponent and spend 2 WP you can call Hit 4
skill.details: Superior aim enables you to drop most armoured combatants with ease.

skill.name: Pinning Shot
rule: Use a bow or crossbow for this skill
If you hit an opponent on a leg and spend 1 WP you can call Hit 1 Fall
skill.details: Penetrating the leg of your enemy will stop him or her from running towards you, at least for a while.

skill.name: Disarming Shot
rule: Use a bow or crossbow for this skill
If you hit an opponent on an arm holding an item and spend 1 WP you can call Hit 1 Drop item
skill.details: Arrows usually cause enough pain and fright to temporarily disable limbs, even if the wound isn't all that lethal.
